title: Ticket #3719: condor_q/condor_status command line debugging
description:
In Progress

This is collecting a variety of reports of problems with condor_q and condor_status, with a focus on how they interpret command line arguments and how that might differ from how a human interprets them. The action for them is to investigate; depending on what is found individual tickets may be opened for bug fixes or feature changes.

condor_status -submitters reports double actual running job count

RESOLVED: See #3713: condor_status -submitters doubles running job count

condor_status -t only works as last option

RESOLVED: See #4096: condor_status -t only works as last option

condor_q -global doesn't report summaries

Reproduced by adesmet in 8.0.0

"condor_q" prints a summary line at the end that looks something like: 

451 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 302 idle, 149 running, 0 held, 0 suspended

"condor_q -global" doesn't pretty a summary of any sort, either overall, or on a per schedd basis.

This may not be a bug (check for regression), just a behavior change request.

condor_status -long -const JobId==...

CLOSED: We can't reproduce. It seems entirely possible that this is a fluke of either catching a job as it's changing states, or catching the job during the window in which the schedd reports it running, but the startd hasn't recognize it. If there is evidence that this is common, we should reinvestigate.

Reported in 8.0.0

Cannot reproduce. 

% condor_status -const 'JobId == "XXXXXXXX.0"' -long

This no longer returns the detailed information about a running job in condor 8.0.0.

Ensure we have automated tests for all of these
